meanings.definition: To make or become dark or darker.
meanings.sent1: She is darkening the room by closing the curtains.
meanings.sent2: The sky is darkening as the sun sets.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child kept darkening the hallway by turning off the lights.
meanings.sent4: His mood started darkening like a storm cloud on the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The forest at night was a place of deep, eerie darkening.

meanings.definition: The process of becoming dark or darker.
meanings.sent1: The darkening of the sky signaled the coming of night.
meanings.sent2: I noticed the gradual darkening of the paint as it dried.
meanings.sent3: The darkening of the chocolate cake made it look even more delicious.
meanings.sent4: The darkening of the leaves in autumn painted the trees in shades of red and gold.
meanings.sent5: The darkening of the room added a sense of mystery to the atmosphere.
